item.title: PNC Financial任命贝莱德前高管为总裁
item.description: PNC 金融服务集团周一任命前贝莱德高管 Mark Wiedman 为总裁，立即生效。【原文：PNC Financial Services Group on Monday appointed former BlackRock executive Mark Wiedman as president, effective immediately.】

item.title: 韩国韩华宇航将增资计划缩减至 16 亿美元
item.description: 韩国最大的防务公司韩华宇航（Hanwha Aerospace）在周二提交的一份监管文件中称，该公司正在修改增资计划，将增资额减少约三分之一，至 2.3 万亿韩元（16 亿美元）。【原文：Hanwha Aerospace , South Korea's largest defence firm, said in a regulatory filing on Tuesday it is revising a planned capital increase to reduce it by around a third to 2.3 trillion won ($1.6 billion).】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司与 Skydance Media 合并期限将延长 90 天
item.description: 根据 Skydance Media 和 Paramount Global 的协议条款，这两家公司价值 80 亿美元的合并将在 4 月 7 日截止日期后自动延长 90 天。【原文：Skydance Media and Paramount Global's $8 billion merger would be automatically extended by 90 days after its deadline of April 7 under the terms of the companies' agreement.】

item.title: 关税迫在眉睫刺激芯片销售，三星第一季度利润超预期
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）周二预计第一季度营业利润同比下降 0.2%，由于智能手机销售稳健和存储芯片销售好于预期，该公司第一季度营业利润远高于分析师预期。【原文：Samsung Electronics on Tuesday estimated a 0.2% drop in first-quarter operating profit from a year earlier, beating analysts' estimates by far on solid smartphone sales and better-than-expected sales of memory chips.】

item.title: 参议员华纳称特朗普新的 TikTok 延期可能违法
item.description: 参议院情报委员会的头号民主党人周一表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统决定延长中国字节跳动剥离短视频应用 TikTok 美国资产的最后期限违反了法律。【原文：The top Democrat on the Senate Intelligence Committee said on Monday that President Donald Trump's decision to extend a deadline for China-based ByteDance to divest short video app TikTok's U.S. assets violates the law.】

item.title: 人工智能公司 Anthropic 宣布在欧洲设立 100 个职位，并任命新的欧洲、中东和非洲地区主管
item.description: 克劳德聊天机器人背后的美国人工智能公司Anthropic周一表示，它将在欧洲（包括都柏林和伦敦）设立100多个职位，并任命纪尧姆-普林森（Guillaume Princen）为欧洲、中东和非洲地区主管。【原文：Anthropic, the U.S. AI company behind the Claude chatbot, said on Monday it would create more than 100 roles in Europe, including in Dublin and London, as it appointed Guillaume Princen as its Europe, Middle East and Africa head.】

item.title: 巴拿马主计长办公室就长江和记续约一事提起诉讼
item.description: 巴拿马总审计长周一表示，巴拿马总审计长办公室将对授权香港长江和记在 2021 年延长巴拿马运河附近两个重要港口 25 年特许经营权的官员提起诉讼。【原文：Panama's Comptroller General office will introduce a lawsuit against the officials who authorized the renewal in 2021 of a 25-year concession to Hong-Kong based CK Hutchison for the operation of two key ports near the Panama Canal, the comptroller general said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国环保局批准得克萨斯州第一口二氧化碳注入井
item.description: 美国环保署周一向西方石油公司（Occidental）颁发了得克萨斯州首张允许钻井注入和储存二氧化碳的许可证。【原文：The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency on Monday issued Texas' first permit to allow drilling to inject and store carbon dioxide to oil company Occidental .】

item.title: 金融科技公司陷入关税动荡
item.description: Robinhood 和 "先买后付 "服务提供商 Affirm 等金融科技公司卷入了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的全面关税漩涡，在对消费者财务状况恶化的担忧中股价大幅下挫。【原文：Financial technology companies like Robinhood and buy now, pay later provider Affirm have been caught in the whirlwind of President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, sending shares sharply downward amid fears about worsening consumer finances.】

item.title: 布伦特原油期货和期权交易量创历史新高，石油市场陷入困境
item.description: 洲际交易所（ICE）的布伦特原油期货和期权合约交易量周五创下历史新高，超过了 COVID-19 大流行期间的水平，因为投资者正在为全球贸易战和欧佩克+石油增产做准备。【原文：Brent crude futures and options contracts traded on the Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) hit record volumes on Friday, surpassing levels seen during the COVID-19 pandemic as investors braced for a global trade war and OPEC+ oil output hikes.】

item.title: 交易日：特朗普的关税大棒仍在挥舞
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 在供应商提出质疑后，航空航天公司就关税问题审查合同
item.description: 业内消息人士周一表示，在一家美国主要供应商引发了关于谁应为新出现的贸易战买单的争论后，飞机制造商、航空公司和供应商正在梳理价值数十亿美元的合同，以检查他们所面临的关税风险。【原文：Planemakers, airlines and suppliers are combing through billions of dollars worth of contracts to check their exposure to tariffs after a major U.S. supplier sparked debate over who should pay for an emerging trade war, industry sources said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国与印度讨论关税问题及 "公平 "贸易的进展
item.description: 美国国务院表示，美国国务卿马尔科-卢比奥（Marco Rubio）和印度外交部长苏布拉哈曼亚姆-杰尚卡尔（Subrahmanyam Jaishankar）周一举行了电话会谈，讨论美国对印度征收关税的问题以及如何朝着 "公平和平衡的贸易关系 "迈进。【原文：U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Indian Foreign Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar held a call on Monday to discuss U.S. tariffs on India and how to make progress towards a "fair and balanced trade relationship," the State Department said.】

item.title: 白宫命令各机构任命首席人工智能官，以扩大人工智能的使用范围
item.description: 白宫管理和预算办公室周一表示，它正在命令联邦机构任命首席人工智能官，以扩大政府对人工智能的使用。【原文：The White House Office of Management and Budget said on Monday it is ordering federal agencies to name chief AI officers as it looks to expand the government's use of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 遭受关税打击的华尔街不禁要问：特朗普会眨眼吗？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的最新关税政策导致华尔街股市暴跌超过 10%，投资者正试图找出他对股市损失的容忍度，一些投资者仍对最终的宽松抱有希望。【原文：Investors are trying to game out how much tolerance U.S. President Donald Trump has for stock market losses after his latest tariff policies ignited a more than 10% wipeout on Wall Street, with some still holding out hope of eventual relief.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 今年将在巴西投资 58 亿美元
item.description: 拉丁美洲电子商务巨头 MercadoLibre 周一表示，计划今年在其第一大市场巴西投资 340 亿雷亚尔（约合 58 亿美元），支出比去年同期增长 47.8%。【原文：Latin American e-commerce giant MercadoLibre said on Monday it plans to invest 34 billion reais ($5.8 billion) this year in its top market, Brazil, representing a 47.8% increase in spending from a year earlier.】

item.title: 英飞凌科技将以 25 亿美元收购 Marvell 的自动以太网业务
item.description: 德国芯片制造商英飞凌科技公司（Infineon Technologies）周一表示，将以约 25 亿美元现金收购 Marvell Technology 公司的汽车以太网业务，以扩大其微控制器业务部门。【原文：German chipmaker Infineon Technologies said on Monday it would buy Marvell Technology's automotive ethernet business for about $2.5 billion in cash, to expand its microcontroller segment.】

item.title: 博通宣布 100 亿美元股票回购计划
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）周一表示，将启动一项新的股票回购计划，在 12 月 31 日前回购高达 100 亿美元的股票。【原文：Broadcom said on Monday it was launching a new share buyback program of up to $10 billion through December 31.】

item.title: 牛仔布需求稳定，Levi Strauss 季度销售额超预期
item.description: 李维-施特劳斯（Levi Strauss）周一公布的第一季度营收超过预期，并维持全年业绩预期，该公司寄希望于其牛仔服装的稳定需求和多样化的供应链，以应对不断升级的贸易战对鞋类和服装零售商的冲击。【原文：Levi Strauss beat first-quarter revenue estimates on Monday and maintained its full-year forecast, betting on steady demand for its denims and a diverse supply chain to navigate an escalating trade war that has hit footwear and apparel retailers.】

item.title: 巴西能源部长要求巴西国家石油公司首席执行官考虑下调柴油价格
item.description: 一位知情人士周一告诉路透社，巴西矿产和能源部长要求巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）首席执行官考虑对出售给巴西经销商的柴油平均价格进行新一轮下调。【原文：Brazil's mines and energy minister asked Petrobras Chief Executive to have the state-run oil firm consider a new cut in the average price of diesel sold to distributors in Brazil, a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普称日本将派团队参加会谈，日本敦促他重新考虑关税问题
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，日本将派出一个团队就贸易问题进行谈判，并补充说他在周一早些时候与日本首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）进行了会谈，石破茂曾单独表示他让特朗普重新考虑关税政策。【原文：Japan is sending a team to negotiate on trade, U.S. President Donald Trump said, adding that he spoke earlier on Monday with Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, who separately said he told Trump to rethink tariff policies.】

item.title: 特朗普表示不会暂停关税，将与中国谈判
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，他不希望暂停征收关税，以便与贸易伙伴进行谈判，但他表示将与中国、日本和其他国家就关税问题进行谈判。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he was not looking at a pause on tariffs to allow for negotiations with trading partners but said he would talk to China, Japan and other countries about the duties.】

item.title: 美国财政部长贝森特将主持与日本的贸易谈判 - 日经新闻
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周二报道，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特将领导与日本的贸易谈判。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will lead trade negotiations with Japan, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 智利 Codelco 公司提高铜产量，董事长看好贸易战前景
item.description: 智利国有铜生产商科德尔科公司（Codelco）董事长马克西莫-帕切科（Maximo Pacheco）周一表示，尽管中美贸易战不断升级，但该公司在2025年前三个月提高了产量，并仍然看好全球需求的长期前景。【原文：Codelco, Chile's state-owned copper producer, boosted production in the first three months of 2025 and was still bullish about long-term prospects for global demand despite an escalating trade war between the U.S. and China, Chairman Maximo Pacheco said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国与巴基斯坦讨论关税、重要矿产和移民问题
item.description: 美国国务院和巴基斯坦外交部分别发表声明说，美国国务卿马可-鲁比奥周一与巴基斯坦外交部长伊沙克-达尔就关税、贸易关系、移民和关键矿产的接触前景等问题进行了交谈。【原文：U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke to Pakistani Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar on Monday about tariffs, trade relations, immigration and prospects for engagement on critical minerals, the State Department and Pakistan's foreign ministry said a separate statements.】

item.title: 文件显示，欧盟委员会建议对部分美国进口商品征收 25% 的反关税
item.description: 路透社看到的一份文件显示，欧盟委员会周一提议对一系列美国商品征收25%的反关税，以回应唐纳德-特朗普总统征收钢铝关税。【原文：The European Commission proposed counter-tariffs of 25% on a range of U.S. goods on Monday in response to President Donald Trump's tariffs on steel and aluminium, a document seen by Reuters showed.】

item.title: 分析师报告称，Traton 警告美国卡车司机因担心经济衰退而推迟订单
item.description: 据伯恩斯坦研究公司（Bernstein Research）的一份分析报告称，大众汽车的卡车部门Traton周一在与投资者的通话中表示，由于担心全球经济衰退，美国的卡车司机正在推迟订单。【原文：Truckers in the United States are deferring orders over fears of a global recession, Volkswagen's truck unit Traton said in a call with investors on Monday, according to an analyst note by Bernstein Research.】

item.title: 智利监管机构：中美贸易战迫在眉睫，铜价可能已见顶
item.description: 智利国家铜业委员会（Cochilco）周一表示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要进一步提高对中国的关税，在贸易战不断升级的情况下，红色金属的价格很可能已经在今年达到顶峰。【原文：Chile's state copper commission Cochilco on Monday said that prices for the red metal have likely already peaked this year amid an escalating trade war, as U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to further increase tariffs on China.】

item.title: 希腊股市可能重获梦寐以求的 "发达市场 "徽章
item.description: 希腊股票本周可能重新获得指数提供商富时罗素（FTSE Russell）梦寐以求的发达市场地位--这是该国在长达十年的债务危机后恢复正常的关键一步，此举可能刺激数百万美元的资金流入。【原文：Greek equities could regain the coveted developed market status by index provider FTSE Russell this week - a key step on the country's return to normalcy following a decade-long debt crisis and a move that could spur millions of dollars in inflows.】

item.title: 贝莱德首席执行官称股市跌幅可能扩大 20%，经济可能陷入衰退
item.description: 贝莱德首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）周一表示，由于美国征收巨额关税，股市可能会扩大20%的跌幅，并指出经济很可能已经陷入衰退。【原文：BlackRock CEO Larry Fink on Monday said stock markets could extend their decline by 20% as the U.S. imposes steep tariffs, noting the economy is probably already in a recession.】
